alert.note: Alert for Fresno (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 10 at 8:56PM PST until March 11 at 12:00AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Rain and Snowmelt in... Northeastern Fresno County in central California... * Until midnight PST. * At 856 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. Rapid snowmelt is also occurring and will add to the flooding. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bishop Pass. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
